great respect for foundation of human rights, via post-Cartesian subjectivity, though must be analyzed, developed, enriched

ATIA.content: Descartes’ 2 criteria (he calls them “methods”) for differentiating authentic from mimetic simulacrum of automaton (still govern method of Lacan & Heidegger): 1) the inability to respond 2) a lack which is not the lack of man, the lacking of the lack of man

LI.content: why did Descartes have to prove the existence of God twice? ][3rd and 5th Meditations?] ——what does it mean to multiply/cite demonstrations/proofs of that beyond all substitution? God, exemplary case: unique, irreplaceable, both absolutely repeatable and unrepeatable

LI.content: [re: SEC] Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing > name of God drawn into graphematic drift (dérive): does name of God refer to God or name of God? “perhaps” of “that it perhaps does not exist” marks fact that “possibility” of graphematics places writing (remainder) outside ontology > [God should exist but in relation to name/reference that “perhaps” does not]

EU.content: the 3 orders (not equally divided, nor can they be discussed apart) that impacted Descartes’ decision to write in French: 1) reinforce establishing of French Law 2) pedagogical facilitation (for women) 3) link btwn philosophical system & some language
EU.linkedContent: the 3 orders (not equally divided, nor can they be discussed apart) that impacted Descartes’ decision to write in French: 1) reinforce establishing of French Law 2) pedagogical facilitation (for women) 3) link btwn philosophical system & some language

EU.content: [vis-à-vis Descartes] link drawn btwn using vulgar language and “facility” for women
EU.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Descartes] link drawn btwn using vulgar language and “facility” for women

EU.content: in 1644, Courcelle’s Latin translation of Discourse of Method doesn’t include Descartes’ “I am speaking French” > when “original” speaks its language by speaking of its language, it prepares a suicide by translation, suicide by fire: almost w/out remainder [tells us about idiomaticity in general]

EU.content: Descartes wrote in vulgar language because he worried the untrained mind would be too tempted by skeptic method of Latin, its schooling, wanted to facilitate a vulgar “facility”
EU.linkedContent: Descartes wrote in vulgar language because he worried the untrained mind would be too tempted by skeptic method of Latin, its schooling, wanted to facilitate a vulgar “facility”
